properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 8:43AM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Alabama...

Alabama River At R.F. Henry Lock and Dam Affecting Autauga...Dallas
and Lowndes Counties.
Alabama River At Selma Affecting Dallas County.

.Heavy rainfall over the Alabama River basin during the past 24
hours is producing rises along the river...and a flood warning is now
in effect at R.F. Henry Dam and Selma

The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Alabama River At Selma.
* from Friday morning until further notice...or until the warning is
cancelled.
* At  8:00 AM Wednesday The stage Was 41.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 45 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...Rise above flood stage by Friday morning and continue to
rise to near 47.5 feet by early Sunday morning. The river will then
begin to fall.
* Impact...At 48 feet...Flooding occurs inland to between Johnson
Street and Old Montgomery Road in Selmont. Portions of Bloch Park
and the Selma Country Club begin to flood. At 45 feet...Extensive
overflow of low lying lands in the area begins. Some low roads in
the area begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.  Turn Around...Don't Drown.

Another statement will be issued by Thursday morning...or sooner if
conditions warrant.
